result.title: LyondellBasell: The Market Seems Skeptical Of The Near 13% Yield
result.text: LyondellBasell Industries (LYB) faces deteriorating financials and segment declines, raising concerns about dividend sustainability despite management's commitment. Q3 saw double-digit sales and EPS declines year-over-year, with all five segments posting weaker results and significant impairment charges. LYB's current near-13% dividend yield signals elevated risk; rising leverage (net debt/EBITDA up to 3.6x) further heightens caution.

result.title: LyondellBasell: Post Buy Call Analysis - Lessons In Cyclical Timing And Dividend Sustainability
result.text: LyondellBasell (LYB) is downgraded from Buy to Hold after a failed contrarian call and a 22% share price decline since May 2025. LYB's margin and cash flow trajectory is improving, with disciplined capex and a $1.1B cash improvement plan supporting dividend sustainability, but risks remain. Despite operational improvements, LYB trades at a higher EV/EBITDA multiple (~9.2x) due to lower forward estimates and uncertain structural demand recovery.

result.title: LyondellBasell Industries: Outlook Improving And 12% Yield Looks Sustainable
result.text: LyondellBasell offers a compelling investment case, with a 12% dividend yield and attractive valuations, despite recent stock underperformance. Industry dynamics are improving, with management's tone turning optimistic as demand rebounds and capacity rationalization accelerates, particularly in North America and Europe. LYB's low-cost US production base provides resilience against Chinese capacity expansion and positions LYB to weather ongoing industry headwinds.

result.title: LyondellBasell prices public offering of guaranteed notes

The Notes will be fully and unconditionally guaranteed by LyondellBasell. The Offering is expected to close on November 13, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Dividend sustainability is under scrutiny, with management likely to maintain payouts as long as possible, but financials and business conditions suggest a cut may be warranted.

result.title: Should You Buy LyondellBasell For Its 11% Yield?
result.text: LyondellBasell (LYB) offers an 11% dividend yield, but weak financials make this a likely yield trap for income investors. LYB's dividend is not covered by earnings or cash flow, with cash burn and rising leverage raising sustainability concerns. Management is likely to cut the dividend significantly within a year if industry conditions do not improve, prioritizing balance sheet health.

result.title: LyondellBasell Industries: Questionable Capital Allocation Raises Red Flags About Dividend Sustainability
result.text: LyondellBasell Industries N.V. appears attractively valued with a high dividend yield but faces deep structural and cyclical challenges. LYB's declining margins, rising debt, and shareholder returns outpacing cash generation raise concerns about dividend sustainability and long-term capital discipline. Valuation metrics look cheap but depend on a cyclical rebound; recent financial performance and margin trends suggest future upcycles may have less upside than previously.

result.title: LyondellBasell's Massive 10% Yield Is A Buy
result.text: LyondellBasell Industries N.V. offers an attractive 11% dividend yield despite current industry downturns, with significant upside potential as market conditions improve. LYB remains profitable and is enhancing competitiveness by shifting production to North America, capitalizing on lower costs and better margins in the region. Cost-cutting measures, reduced growth spending, and asset sales are strengthening LYB's balance sheet and positioning it for higher free cash flow.
